posts.name: Scott Rowe, 3512
posts.cooked: Any issues with the Robiorio and power distribution hub next to each other?  I tend to try and keep power away from the roborio but I may be just paranoid.

posts.name: Jonathan Lane
posts.cooked: You should be fine with those two next to eachother. Just avoid running any PWM , or sensor cables parallel to power cables.

posts.name: Kevin Thompson (mentor)
posts.cooked: We have had ours next to each other for a few years.  No issues.

posts.name: Eric Tate
posts.cooked: No issues with mounting these next to each other.

posts.name: Yishai Levy
posts.cooked: Probably interference, since pwn isn’t like CAN with resistance to interference (the whole difference idea of CAN )

posts.name: Jonathan Lane
posts.cooked: High current electrical lines, can induce ElectroMagnetic Interference (EMI) in other cables nearby. CAN is a differential bus, so it is extremely resistant to any noise or induced interference. However, PWM is a very susceptible data signal with no protections against this. If the signal and power lines cross perpendicularly, you won’t have an issue. It’s only a real issue when run parallel. If you are using any analog sensors as well, those are EXTREMELY susceptible to EMI.
